name: The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name posted above the entrance to Winnie the Pooh's home?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Sanderz

	Posted above the entrance to Winnie the Pooh's tree is a block of wood with the name Mr. Sanderz etched into it. When the movie began, Winnie the Pooh was sitting outside his home. No explanation is given as to why the name is above Winnie the Pooh's home.

questions.text: While doing his exercises, what part of Winnie the Pooh split?
questions.explanation:
His back.

	While watching himself doing exercises in the mirror, Pooh was trying to touch his toes when his back split open. Pooh laughed it off as he tied up the split and continued his exercises. After his exercises, Pooh began breakfast only to discover he was out of honey.

questions.text: What part of Eeyore's body was Christopher Robin seen nailing back into place?
questions.explanation:
Tail.

	When Eeyore was first seen, Christopher Robin was nailing his tail back into place. Eeyore didn't seem upset that his tail had fallen off. Pooh joined the group to borrow a balloon to use as a way to get to the honey in a tree filled with bees.

questions.text: Using a blue balloon and the help of Christopher Robin, what did Winnie the Pooh dress up as to trick the bees into leaving the tree filled with honey?
questions.explanation:
Black rain cloud.

	Pooh doused himself in mud and used the balloon to lift himself up to the hole in the tree where the honey was. The disguise didn't work on the bees and they went after Pooh. Christopher Robin used his black umbrella to hide him and Pooh in the mud so the bees wouldn't see them.

questions.text: After joining them for lunch, in whose front door did Winnie the Pooh get stuck?
questions.explanation:
Rabbit.

	Rabbit was sitting down for lunch when Pooh stopped by and offered to have lunch with him. Upon leaving through the front door (a hole in the dirt), Pooh became stuck. It took days of Pooh not eating to get him unstuck. With Christopher Robin and the others pulling and Rabbit pushing, Pooh flew out of Rabbit's front door and into the hole in the tree with honey inside it. This was the same tree he had been trying to get honey from in the beginning of the movie.

questions.text: Inside what tree did Piglet live?
questions.explanation:
Beech.

	Piglet mentioned living in a beech tree. While sweeping the front of his walk, Piglet explained the tree belonged to his grandfather. Outside the tree, there was a torn sign that had 'Trespassers will' etched on it. The rest of the words were gone along with the torn part of the sign. Piglet said that was his grandfather's initials, T.W.

questions.text: Whose house fell down after being hit with a blustery wind?
questions.explanation:
Owl.

	Owl asked Pooh if he brought down Owl's house because Pooh was there when the tree fell. Christopher Robin told Owl this wasn't something that could easily be fixed. Eeyore went in search of a new home for Owl.

questions.text: When a flood hit the Hundred-Acre Wood, to whose home did Rabbit, Tigger, Kanga, and Roo go?
questions.explanation:
Christopher Robin.

	Because the flood waters couldn't get to Christopher Robin's house, Tigger used Christopher Robin's black umbrella as a boat and rowed Rabbit, Kanga, Roo, and himself to Christopher Robin's house. When the rain kept falling it filled Piglet and Pooh's house. Piglet became stuck on a piece of furniture and Pooh got stuck in a honey pot while trying to save his supper. Eeyore was out looking for a home for Owl. When the rain stopped and the flood waters disappeared, Eeyore showed Owl his new home. It was Piglet's house. With Owl living in Piglet's house, Pooh asked Piglet to live with him.

questions.text: Whose garden did Tigger destroy when he bounced into it?
questions.explanation:
Rabbit.

	Tigger introduced himself to Pooh during a stormy night when he bounced into Pooh's house and knocked Pooh over. He introduced himself to Piglet while Piglet was outside his house. Tigger introduced himself to Rabbit by jumping on him while Rabbit was gathering food from his garden. Tigger destroyed the food in Rabbit's garden and Rabbit became upset. Tigger bounced off.

questions.text: At the end of the movie, where did Christopher Robin tell Winnie the Pooh and his friends he had to go and wouldn't be back for a while?
questions.explanation:
School.

	It was a fitting end to the movie to have Christopher Robin tell Pooh that he was going to school and wouldn't be back to the Hundred Acre Wood for a while. Pooh was sad, but told Christopher Robin he would be there whenever Christopher Robin returned.
